thread.title: GE beats profit expectations as aviation counters weak oil segment
thread.title_full: GE beats profit expectations as aviation counters weak oil segment

title: GE beats profit expectations as aviation counters weak oil segment
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Oct 16, 2015, 12:48 BST - UK Markets close in 3 hrs 42 mins General Electric profit beats expectations, buoyed by aviation Reuters – 25 minutes ago View Photo 
The logo of U.S. conglomerate General Electric is pictured at the company's site in Belfort, June 23, … (Reuters) - General Electric Co (GE.N) on Friday posted higher-than-expected quarterly profit, as its businesses producing jet engines and power turbines offset declines in its oil and gas segment. 
The U.S. conglomerate, which is pulling back from financial services, said its industrial revenue grew 4 percent, excluding the impact of foreign currency swings and acquisitions. 
GE, which backed its full-year profit outlook, said it expects to retire as much as 7 percent of its outstanding floated shares by mid-November, as it completes the spinoff of its former retail finance business, Synchrony Financial (SYF.N). The Federal Reserve earlier this week said Synchrony could function as a standalone company. 
The conglomerate overall reported third-quarter net earnings of $2.51 billion, or 25 cents per share, compared with $3.54 billion, or 35 cents per share, a year ago. 
Excluding special items, earnings of 29 cents a share exceeded the average estimate of analysts by three cents, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S. 
Revenue fell 1.3 percent to $31.68 billion, weighed by a 16 percent slump in its segment supplying equipment and services to oil and gas customers, which has been hurt by weak crude prices. 
Revenue in its aviation segment increased 5 percent, while revenue in its power and water division, its biggest segment, grew 1 percent. 
(Reporting by Lewis Krauskopf in New York; Editing by W Simon and Bernadette Baum)
